intro: Xanthoxalis coloradensis, commonly known as the Colorado goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Xanthoxalis coloradensis is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
